byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Gardiner Harris, Nida Najar and Hari Kumar from New Delhi; Bhadra Sharma from Katmandu, Nepal; Chris Buckley from Hong Kong; and Kenneth Chang from New York.

abstract: Magnitude 7.8 earthquake strikes Nepal near capital of Katmandu, killing more than 1,800 people and causing devastation across country; quake is followed by 12 significant aftershocks; most of worst damage is sustained in oldest part of city, and four of area's seven Unesco World Heritage sites are severely damaged.
lead_paragraph: The earthquake struck near Katmandu. Residents described scenes of panic, and trekkers reported a major avalanche on Mount Everest.

headline.main: Earthquake Devastates Nepal, Killing More Than 1,900

snippet: The earthquake struck near Katmandu. Residents described scenes of panic, and trekkers reported a major avalanche on Mount Everest.
